main event: A witness observed a round, metallic object hovering above the trees for some time before it darted away at high speed in Beavercreek, Ohio on June 6, 1963.
interesting points: The object appeared bright metallic to reddish-orange in color.
The witness observed the object through 8x binoculars.
The object was described as smaller than a real balloon and climbed out of sight, becoming smaller and smaller.
The witness initially thought the object was a balloon, but the description and motion indicated it was not a conventional aircraft.
Several other farmers in the area had reported similar sightings of unidentified objects.
photographs: No, the report does not include any photographs
